name: amazon-q-vscode
description: The most capable generative AI-powered assistant for building, operating, and transforming software, with advanced capabilities for managing data and AI

scripts.vscode:prepublish: npm run clean && npm run buildScripts && webpack --mode production
scripts.buildScripts: npm run generateNonCodeFiles && npm run copyFiles && npm run generateIcons && npm run generateSettings && tsc -p ./ --noEmit
scripts.compile: npm run clean && npm run buildScripts && webpack
scripts.watch: npm run clean && npm run buildScripts && tsc -watch -p ./
scripts.testCompile: npm run clean && npm run buildScripts && npm run compileOnly
scripts.test: npm run testCompile && c8 --allowExternal ts-node ../core/scripts/test/launchTest.ts unit dist/test/unit/index.js ../core/dist/src/testFixtures/workspaceFolder
scripts.testE2E: npm run testCompile && c8 --allowExternal ts-node ../core/scripts/test/launchTest.ts e2e dist/test/e2e/index.js ../core/dist/src/testFixtures/workspaceFolder
scripts.testWeb: npm run compileDev && c8 --allowExternal ts-node ../core/scripts/test/launchTest.ts web dist/test/web/testRunnerWebCore.js
scripts.webWatch: npm run clean && npm run buildScripts && webpack --mode development --watch

configuration.properties: Any settings also defined in packages/core/package.json will override same-named settings in this file.

viewsWelcome.contents:
Project transformation is complete.
 Downloading the proposed changes...
No code issues have been detected in the workspace.

walkthroughs.title: Meet Amazon Q
walkthroughs.description: Your generative AI-powered assistant across the software development lifecycle.

steps.title: Get inline code suggestions
steps.description:
Amazon Q suggests code as you type based on your open files. Accepted suggestions from licensed code will go into the Code Reference Log.

[Try Example](command:_aws.amazonq.walkthrough.inlineSuggestionsExample)

**TIP: Invoke manually with opt/alt + c**

steps.title: Ask using chat
steps.description:
Amazon Q answers software development questions, writes code based on your current file, and cites sources.

Use the right-click menu for quick commands.

**TIP: Drag and drop the Q panel to dock on the right**

steps.title: Check for security vulnerabilities
steps.description:
Amazon Q scans your code to identify security vulnerabilities and suggests fixes.

Start a scan from the status bar menu.

[Scan your current project](command:_aws.amazonq.walkthrough.securityScanExample)

Identifies vulnerabilities in Python, Typescript, Ruby, AWS CDK, and [more](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazonq/latest/qdeveloper-ug/q-language-ide-support.html#security-scans-language-support)

steps.title: Access actions and options
steps.description:
Pause inline suggestions, open the Code Reference Log, access Settings, and more from the Amazon Q menu.

[Open the status bar menu](command:_aws.amazonq.walkthrough.listCommands)
